Definition: Ulcerative colitis is a chronic inflammatory bowel disease that causes inflammation and ulcers in the digestive tract.
Causes: Exact cause is unknown; may involve genetic and environmental factors.
Symptoms: Abdominal pain, diarrhea, and rectal bleeding.
Diagnosis: Colonoscopy, imaging studies, and blood tests.
Treatment: Medications, dietary changes, and surgery in severe cases.

Definition: An ulnar collateral ligament injury is a common injury in the elbow, particularly among athletes.
Symptoms: Pain on the inner elbow, swelling, and instability.
Treatment: Rest, physical therapy, and sometimes surgery.

Definition: Undifferentiated pleomorphic sarcoma is a rare type of soft tissue sarcoma that is aggressive and often occurs in the limbs.
Causes: Exact cause is often unknown; may involve genetic factors.
Symptoms: Lump or swelling, pain, and functional impairment.

Definition: Urethral cancer is a rare type of cancer that occurs in the urethra, the tube that carries urine from the bladder.
Causes: Exact cause is often unknown; may involve risk factors like HPV.
Symptoms: Blood in urine, pain during urination, and frequent urination.

Definition: Urethritis is inflammation of the urethra, often caused by infection.
Causes: Bacterial infections, sexually transmitted infections, and irritants.
Treatment: Antibiotics and management of underlying causes.

Definition: Urge incontinence is a type of urinary incontinence characterized by a sudden, intense urge to urinate followed by involuntary loss of urine.
Causes: Neurological disorders, bladder inflammation, and certain medications.
Treatment: Behavioral therapies, medications, and pelvic floor exercises.

Definition: Urinary incontinence is the involuntary loss of urine, which can affect quality of life.
Causes: Weak pelvic floor muscles, neurological disorders, and urinary tract infections.
Symptoms: Leakage of urine, urgency, and frequency.
Treatment: Behavioral therapies, medications, and surgical options.

Definition: A urinary tract infection is an infection in any part of the urinary system, including the bladder and urethra.
Causes: Bacterial infections, often from E. coli.
Symptoms: Frequent urination, burning sensation, and cloudy urine.

Definition: Uterine cancer is a type of cancer that begins in the lining of the uterus.
Causes: Hormonal imbalances, obesity, and genetic factors.
Symptoms: Abnormal vaginal bleeding, pelvic pain, and weight loss.
Diagnosis: Pelvic examination, imaging studies, and biopsy.

Definition: Uterine fibroids are noncancerous growths of the uterus that often appear during childbearing years.
Causes: Exact cause is unknown; may involve hormonal factors.
Symptoms: Heavy menstrual bleeding, pelvic pain, and pressure symptoms.

Definition: Uterine prolapse occurs when the uterus slips down into the vaginal canal due to weakened pelvic floor muscles.
Symptoms: Pelvic pressure, urinary issues, and visible bulge.
Treatment: Pelvic floor exercises, pessaries, and surgery.

Definition: Uterine sarcoma is a rare type of cancer that begins in the muscle or other tissues of the uterus.
Causes: Exact cause is often unknown; may involve genetic factors.
Symptoms: Abnormal bleeding, pelvic pain, and abdominal swelling.
Diagnosis: Imaging studies, biopsy, and clinical evaluation.
